info.title: BaaS Backoffice
info.description:
BaaS Backoffice

Api responsible for managing backoffice operations, reports, etc.

## Internal Operation Status

| Status | Description | Final Status | Notification Event Type |
| ------ | ----------- | ------------ | ----------------------  |
| CREATED       | Operation created | | |
| CONFIRMING    | Operation begin verified with the client if it was requested by him | | |
| CONFIRMED     | Operation confirmed by the client | | |
| NOT_CONFIRMED | Operation denied by the client | Yes | backoffice_internal_operation_not_confirmed |
| PROCESSING    | Processing bank operation | | |
| REJECTED      | Operation rejected due internal validation | Yes | backoffice_internal_operation_rejected |
| ERROR         | Failure to process | Yes | backoffice_internal_operation_error | |
| DONE          | Operation completed successfully | Yes | backoffice_internal_operation_done |

## Internal Operation Confirmation Call

To receive the confirmation, its necessary the previous registration of the client url.
  This object will be sent as an HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 202 status and within 10 seconds.

**Internal Operation Confirmation Call Scheme**

  Headers:
  ```json
  {
    X-R4-Application: GUID // Application Unique Identifier
    X-R4-Delivery: GUID // Attempt Unique Identifier
    X-R4-Event: internal_operation_confirmation
    User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
  }
  ```
  Body
  ```json
  {
    "object_kind": "internal_operation_confirmation",
    "object_id": "GUID", // Internal Operation Unique Identifier
    "application_id": "GUID", // Application Unique Identifier
    "account_id": "GUID", // Account Unique Identifier
    "account_number": 1234567,
    "account_digit": 7,
    "agency_number": 1,
    "value": 10.12,
    "history_code": "PAYROLL_LOAN_RELEASE_CREDIT"
  }
  ```

## Internal Operation Status Change Notification

Some statuses changes will fire a notification call to the client.

To receive this notifications, its necessary to request the registration of the service URL which will receive the notification object.

This object will be sent as a HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 200 status.

| Event Type          | Internal Operation Status     |
|-------------------- | -------------- |
| `backoffice_internal_operation_not_confirmed` | NOT_CONFIRMED |
| `backoffice_internal_operation_rejected` | REJECTED |
| `backoffice_internal_operation_error` | ERROR |
| `backoffice_internal_operation_done` | DONE |

### Notification Call Scheme

#### *Header*
```json
{
  X-R4-Application: GUID, // Application Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Delivery: GUID, // Attempt Unique Identifier
  X-R4-Event: {event_type}, // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table)
  User-Agent: R4-Hookshot
}
```

#### *Body*
```
{
  "object_kind": "{event_type}", // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table)
  "object_id": "GUID", // Operation Unique Identifier
  "account_id": "GUID" // Account Unique Identifier
  "application_id": "GUID" // Application Unique Identifier
}
```

## Generic errors

Every request may return one of the following error formats:

### 400

Returned when the request schema is not valid.

```json
{
  "error": {
    "code": "VALIDATION_FAILED",
    "message": "Invalid request data",
    "details": [
      {
        "message": "Some error message",
        "path": [
          "query",
          "status",
          0
        ],
        "type": "any.only",
        "context": {
          "valids": [
            "CREATED",
            "PROCESSING",
            "PROCESSED",
            "ERROR"
          ],
          "label": "query.status[0]",
          "value": "ERRORe",
          "key": 0
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

### 401

Returned when request is unauthorized

```json
{
  "code": "AUTHENTICATION_FAILED",
  "message": "Authentication failed."
}
```

### 403

Returned when request is forbidden

```json
{
  "code": "MISSING_PRODUCT_PERMISSION",
  "message": "Missing product permission."
}
```
```json
{
  "code": "PRODUCT_DISABLED",
  "message": "Product is not enabled."
}
```
```json
{
  "code": "APPLICATION_PRODUCT_NOT_FOUND",
  "message": "Product not found for given application id."
}
```
```json
{
  "code": "PROFILE_NOT_FOUND",
  "message": "Profile not found."
}
```

### 404

Returned when resource is not found

```json

{
  "code": "NOT_FOUND",
  "message": "Unable to found the requested account."
}
```

### 5xx

Returned when a request fails and it is our fault

```json
{
  "statusCode": 500,
  "message": "Unexpected error with our service",
  "code": "INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR"
}
```

get.summary: Get a list payments with pending antifraud analysis

parameters.description: Filter to search for payments after the given amount

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Filter to search for payments before the given amount

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of payments to be returned

200.description: List of payments with pending antifraud analysis

kind.description: Type of mechanism used to start the payment

payment_priority.description: Indicates whether liquidation is priority or not

type_payment_priority.description: Indicate whether it is a priority transaction or not

document_payment_initiator.description: CNPJ of the payment initiator institution

initiation_channel.description: Property indicates the payment initiation channel

open_banking.description: Indicates that the payment was initiated in the Open Banking

initiator_name.description: Name of the payment initiator institution

value_details.description:
The element group used to break down payment amounts

* If the goal is equal to `BUY_OR_TRANSFER` do not inform this field.
* If the goal is equal to `CHANGE` is mandatory to inform two different
groups, one with the kind equal to `PURCHASE_AMOUNT` and another with
the kind equal to `AVAILABLE_CASH`.
* If the goal is equal to `WITHDRAW` is mandatory to inform one group with
the kind equal to `AVAILABLE_CASH`.

kind.description:
The value kind.

* `PURCHASE_AMOUNT`: The purchase amount
* `AVAILABLE_CASH`: Value of the resource in kind provided.

value.description: The purchase value or the value of the resource in kind provided

after.description: cursor pointing at the last item of the list. If no more items exist, the property is removed from the response

before.description: cursor pointing at the first item of the list. If its the first available item, the property is removed from the response
